<br><font color=blue size=4>AAL  </font><br>1. ATM Adaptation Layer：ATM 适配层
<br><font color=blue size=4>AAL0  </font><br>ATM Adaptation Layer Type 0 refers to raw ATM cells.
<br><font color=blue size=4>AAL1  </font><br>ATM Adaptation Layer Type 1 supports constant bit rate, time-dependent traffic such as voice and video.
<br><font color=blue size=4>AAL2  </font><br>AAL Layer Type 2 reserved for variable bit rate video transfer.
<br><font color=blue size=4>AAL3  </font><br>AAL3:AAL Type 3 supports variable bit rate, delay-tolerant data traffic requiring some sequencing and/or error detection support.
<br><font color=blue size=4>AAL4  </font><br>AAL4:AAL Type 4 supports variable bit rate, delay-tolerant data traffic requiring some sequencing and/or error detection support.
<br><font color=blue size=4>AAL5  </font><br>AAL Type 5 supports variable bit rate, delay-tolerant connection-oriented data traffic requiring minimal sequencing or error detection support.
<br><font color=blue size=4>AAL5-CU  </font><br>ATM Adaptation Layer 5 Composite User, ATM匹配层5组合用户

<br><font color=blue size=4>Alias Frequency  </font><br>A false lower-frequency component that occurs in analog data that is sampled from data that is originally digitized at too low a frequency.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Aliasing  </font><br>In a sampled data system, the analog input must be sampled at a rate of at least twice the bandwidth of the signal in order to avoid loss of data (Nyquist Theorem). Adhering to the Nyquist Theorem prevents in-band "alias" signals, which are beat frequencies between the analog signal and the sampling clock that inherently occur.

<br><font color=blue size=4>byTimingReport  </font><br>上报S1字节给交叉板后，如果没有得到交叉板的应答，单板定时上报S1字节的计数器

<br><font color=blue size=4>byTimingReportBeforeAnswer  </font><br>//上报时钟状态给交叉板后，如果没有得到交叉板的应答，单板定时上报时钟状态的计数器

<br><font color=blue size=4>Capacitance Non-Linearity  </font><br>A relationship between the actual and measured capacitance across a range that cannot be described with a straight line. The most common source of non-linearity is connection or cable error. See also cable compensation.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Capacitance Voltage  </font><br>The relationship (or curve) of capacitance versus voltage for a device. Generally measured on Schottky, P-N, or MIS structures. C-V curves are of interest to ascertain device geometry, internal device potentials, and device charges.

<br><font color=blue size=4>Combination Oscilloscopes  </font><br>Analog/digital scopes. Some DSO's can be switched back and forth between their DSO mode of operation and an Analog mode of operation, with no digitizer, and no memory in use. Sometimes this is used to verify the credibility and familiarity of the input signal.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Combiner  </font><br>The totaling of signals into one transmission line. Though the peak voltage from each signal will be combined they will be more than the sum of the power would indicate.

<br><font color=blue size=4>Common Mode Voltage  </font><br>A voltage between input low and chassis ground of an instrument.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Compile  </font><br>1. To translate a computer program expressed in a high-level language into a program expressed in a lower level language, such as an intermediate language, assembly language, or a machine language. 2. To prepare a machine language program from a computer program written in another programming language by making use of the overall logic structure of the program or by generating more than one computer instruction for each symbolic statement as well as performing the function of an assembler.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Composite Sync  </font><br>A video signal that has a no-signal reference level and contains horizontal-sync pulses, vertical-sync pulses, and equalizing pulses only.

<br><font color=blue size=4>Conducted Emission  </font><br>Electromagnetic energy generated along a conductor. If it is unwanted it is known as conducted interference.

<br><font color=blue size=4>Contrast  </font><br>1. In display systems, the relation between (a) the intensity of color, brightness, or shading of an area occupied by a display element, display group, or display image on the display surface of a display device and (b) the intensity of an area not occupied by a display elements, a display group, or a display image.

<br><font color=blue size=4>Control Station  </font><br>(As regards antenna) A fixed location station which uses its transmissions to control the operation of another fixed station, i.e. a repeater. 　　控制台（天线）：也称为中继站；它是一种固定站（台），通过发送信号来控制其它固定台的操作运行。

<br><font color=blue size=4>Conversion  </font><br>A process where a signal is changed from an analog to digital (A-D) representation, or digital to analog (D-A).
<br><font color=blue size=4>Conversion Time  </font><br>The time it takes for accurate data to become available once a channel is interrogated. Usually associated with DACs and ADCs.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Convolution  </font><br>The synthesis, in time, of the product of two functions. Convolution is to the time domain what multiplication is to the frequency domain.

<br><font color=blue size=4>Frame Relay  </font><br>An interface protocol for statistically multiplexed packet-switched data communications in which (a) variable-sized packets (frames) are used that completely enclose the user packets they transport, and (b) transmission rates are usually between 56 kb/s and 1.544 Mb/s (the T-1 rate).

<br><font color=blue size=4>G.726  </font><br>An ITU standard for speech codecs that uses the ADPCM method to compress 64 Kbps PCM into 40, 32, 24 or 16 Kbps depending on available channel bandwidth. G.726 generally replaces G.721 and G.723.
<br><font color=blue size=4>G.729  </font><br>An ITU standard for speech codecs that uses the CELP method and provides toll quality audio at 8 Kbps.

<br><font color=blue size=4>H  </font><br>(Henry.) The unit of inductance in which an induced electromotive force of one volt is produced when the current is varied at the rate of one ampere per second
<br><font color=blue size=4>H.225  </font><br>An ITU standard protocol for control signaling in an H.323 audio or video environment. H.225 uses messages defined in H.245 to establish the call over the Registration, Admission and Signaling (RAS) channel.
<br><font color=blue size=4>H.235  </font><br>Specifies security and encryption for H.323 and H.245 based terminals.
<br><font color=blue size=4>H.245  </font><br>An ITU standard protocol for control messages in an H.225 audio or videoconferencing call. The messages are used for flow control, encryption and jitter management as well as for initiating the call, negotiating which features should be used and terminating the call. It also determines which side is the master for issuing various commands.
<br><font color=blue size=4>H.246  </font><br>Specifies internetworking of H Series terminals with circuit switched terminals.

Pertaining to a material with properties, such as density, electrical conductivity, electric permitivity, magnetic permeability, or refractive index that do not vary with distance or direction. 2. Pertaining to a material with magnetic, electrical, or electromagnetic properties that do not vary with the direction of static or propagating magnetic, electrical, or electromagnetic fields within the material.

<br><font color=blue size=4>LEA  </font><br>1. Long Loop Ethernet Access
<br><font color=blue size=4>Leaching  </font><br>The process where liquid solder is responsible for dissolving a metal coating.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Lead  </font><br>A wire used to connect two separate points in a circuit, normally self-supporting.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Lead Coplanarity  </font><br>The position of all of the component leads relative to one another when using a reference plane which has been defined by the three lowest leads of a component.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Leaded Device  </font><br>Electronic devices which contain electrical leads that extend from the body of the package.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Lead Frame  </font><br>A sheet metal framework that has been etched to form an array of metal traces (leads). An IC is then attached to the lead frame at the innermost portion of the leads, and the outermost portion of the leads is subsequently attached to the next level of the assembly.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Leadless Device  </font><br>Unlike a leaded device, these are electronic devices which do not have electrical leads extending from the body of the package.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Lead Pitch  </font><br>The sum of the lead width and lead spacing.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Lead Plating  </font><br>The metal coating place on a component lead.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Lead Spacing  </font><br>The distance existing between adjacent leads within a defined area of a component.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Lead Thickness  </font><br>As regards component leads, it is the sum of the thickness of the base metal, plating, and total fabrication tolerances.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Lead Width  </font><br>The width of the lead in a defined area of a component.
<br><font color=blue size=4>LEAF  </font><br>Large Effective Area Fiber
<br><font color=blue size=4>leaf internetwork  </font><br>In a star topology, an internetwork whose sole access to other internetworks in the star is through a core router.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Leakage Current  </font><br>Current that flows through or across the insulator that resides between two electrodes. Normally, this is miniscule amount of current.
<br><font color=blue size=4>leaky bucket  </font><br>In ATM, a metaphor for the GCRA, which is used for conformance checking of cell
<br><font color=blue size=4>LEAP  </font><br>Lightweight Extensible Authentication Protocol
<br><font color=blue size=4>LE-ARP  </font><br>LAN Emulation Address Resolution Protocol
<br><font color=blue size=4>LEC  </font><br>1. LAN Emulation Client局域网仿真客户　
<br><font color=blue size=4>LECS  </font><br>LAN Emulation Configuration Server局域网仿真配置服务器　
<br><font color=blue size=4>LED  </font><br>Light Emitting Diode  发光二级管
<br><font color=blue size=4>LEF  </font><br>Library Exchange Format
<br><font color=blue size=4>Leg Angle  </font><br>In relation to a plane perpendicular to the plane defined by the bottom of the component, the angle of the vertical portion of a lead.
<br><font color=blue size=4>LELAN  </font><br>License exempt Wireless Local Area Networks

<br><font color=blue size=4>Noise  </font><br>1. An undesired disturbance within the frequency band of interest; the sum-mation of unwanted or disturbing energy introduced into a communications system from man-made and natural sources. 2. A disturbance that affects a signal and that may distort the information carried by the signal. 3. Random variations of one or more characteristics of any entity such as voltage, current, or data. 4. A random signal of known statistical properties of amplitude, distribution, and spectral density.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Noise Distortion  </font><br>When circuits are driven with a broadband noise signal, the nonlinear behavior that results.
<br><font color=blue size=4>Noise Floor  </font><br>(1) A cutoff point from which no appreciable information from a signal can be retrieved below. (2) The minimum discernible signal that can be detected by a receiver.

<br><font color=blue size=4>Nyquist Sampling Theorem  </font><br>This theorem states that if a continuous bandwidth-limited signal contains no frequency components higher than fC, then the original signal can be recovered without distortion as long as it is sampled at a rate of at least 2 fC.

<br><font color=blue size=4>peer  </font><br>同位体：在分层通信网络中，任何工作于相同协议层的设备。
<br><font color=blue size=4>peer-to-peer architecture  </font><br>点对点结构：由两台或两台以上计算机组成的网络，这些计算机通过使用相同的程序或同种类型的程序进行通信和共享数据。每台计算机或同位体都具有相同的职责，并都可作为网络中其他计算机的服务器。与客户/服务器结构不同，点对点结构没有专门的文件服务器，因此，其网络性能通常不如客户/服务器结构的网络，在大负载情况下尤其如此。
<br><font color=blue size=4>peer-to-peer communications  </font><br>点对点通信：在分层结构的网络中，工作于同一通信级别上的各个设备之间所进行的交互。
<br><font color=blue size=4>peer-to-peer network  </font><br>点对点网络

<br><font color=blue size=4>routing  </font><br>Process of finding a path to a destination host.
<br><font color=blue size=4>routing metric  </font><br>Method by which a routing algorithm determines that one route is better than another.This information is stored in routing tables. Metrics include bandwidth, communication cost, delay, hop count, load, MTU, path cost, and reliability.

<br><font color=blue size=4>T1  </font><br>1次群速率，美洲标准
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.120  </font><br>T.120 standard is composed of a suite of communication and application layer protocols. These protocols enable developers to create compatible products and services for real-time, multipoint data connections and conferencing.
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.121  </font><br>This standard provides a generic application template (GAT), which specifies a common set of guidelines for building application protocols. To ensure application consistency, T.121 is a required standard for products developed under T.120.
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.122  </font><br>The T.122 standard defines the multipoint services that enable one or more participants to send data as part of a conference. These multipoint services are implemented by T.125, which provides the mechanism for transporting the data. Together, the T.122 and T.125 standards make up the T.120 Multipoint Communication Services (MCS).
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.123  </font><br>The T.123 standard is responsible for transporting and sequencing data, and for controlling the flow of data across networks, including connect, disconnect, send, and receive functions. For data transport, T.123 defines a series of network interface profiles. T.123 also provides an error-correcting mechanism that ensures accurate and reliable data delivery.
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.124  </font><br>Generic Conference Control (GCC): The definition of the application protocol supporting reservations and basic conference control services for multipoint teleconferences.
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.125  </font><br>This standard specifies how data is transmitted within a conference. T.125 defines the private and broadcast channels that transport the data and ensures accurate and efficient communication among multiple users. T.125 implements the multipoint services defined by T.122.
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.126  </font><br>Multipoint still-image and annotation protocol: Definitions for collaborative data sharing, image sharing, graphic display information, and image exchange in a multipoint conference.
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.127  </font><br>This standard defines how files are transferred simultaneously among conference participants. T.127 enables one or more files to be selected and transmitted in compressed or uncompressed form to all or selected participants during a conference.
<br><font color=blue size=4>T.128  </font><br>This standard defines how application sharing orders are transmitted.

<br><font color=blue size=4>X.121  </font><br>ITU-T standard describing an addressing scheme used in X.25 networks. X.121 addresses are sometimes called IDNs (International Data Numbers).

<br><font color=blue size=4>X.21  </font><br>ITU-T standard for serial communications over synchronous digital lines.
<br><font color=blue size=4>X.21bis  </font><br>ITU-T standard that defines the physical layer protocol for communication between DCE and DTE in an X.25 network. Virtually equivalent to EIA/TIA-232.
<br><font color=blue size=4>X.25  </font><br>ITU-T standard that defines how connections between DTE and DCE are maintained for remote terminal access and computer communications in PDNs. X.25 specifies LAPB, a data link layer protocol, and PLP, a network layer protocol. Frame Relay has to some degree superseded X.25.
<br><font color=blue size=4>X25  </font><br>CCITT's recommendation for the interface between a DTE and DCE over a PSTN
<br><font color=blue size=4>X.28  </font><br>ITU-T recommendation that defines the terminal-to-PAD interface in X.25 networks.
<br><font color=blue size=4>X.29  </font><br>ITU-T recommendation that defines the form for control information in the terminal-to-PAD interface used in X.25 networks.
<br><font color=blue size=4>X.3  </font><br>ITU-T recommendation that defines various PAD parameters used in X.25 networks.

<br><font color=blue size=4>YWHSMS  </font><br>You Will Have Snail Mail Soon
<br><font color=blue size=4>YWSTWY  </font><br>You Would Say That Wouldn't You
<br><font color=blue size=4>YYGT  </font><br>Yes, You Get That
<br><font color=blue size=4>YYRH  </font><br>Yes, Your Royal Highness
<br><font color=blue size=4>YYY  </font><br>Yadda, Yadda, Yadda
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZABS  </font><br>Zambia Bureau of Standards
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZBR  </font><br>zoned bit recording
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZBT  </font><br>Zero Bus Turnaround
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZBTSI  </font><br>Zero-Byte Time Slot Interchange [Communications]零字节时间插槽互换
<br><font color=blue size=4>Z-CAV  </font><br>Zoned Constant Angular Velocity
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZCAV  </font><br>Zoned - Constant Angular Velocity
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZCS  </font><br>Zero Code Suppression零码压缩
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZDL  </font><br>Zero Delay Lockout
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZENGWENBIN  </font><br>华为无名小卒一名
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZF  </font><br>Zero Forcing
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZhangWei  </font><br>华为另一无名小卒
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZIA  </font><br>Zero-power Interconnect Array
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZIF  </font><br>Zero Insertion Force (socket)
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZIP  </font><br>1. AppleTalk Zone Information Protocol, manages the relationship between network numbers and zone names
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZIT  </font><br>Zone Information Table, AppleTalk 的区信息表
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZLB  </font><br>Zero-Length-Body (L2TP)
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZLP  </font><br>Zero Loss Plan 零损失计划
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZP  </font><br>Zone Prefix
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZS  </font><br>Zero Suppression 零压缩
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZSL  </font><br>Zero Slot LAN
<br><font color=blue size=4>ZVS  </font><br>Zero Voltage Switch
<br><font color=blue size=4>五元组  </font><br>一个完整的网间进程通信需要一个五元组来标识：（协议，本机地址，本地端口号，远地地址，远地端口号）
<br><font color=blue size=4>信息摘要  </font><br>由一个hash算法从要发送的信息中得到一个定长的字符串，也称为数字指纹
<br><font color=blue size=4>免费ARP  </font><br>主机将自己的IP地址作为目的地址发送ARP包，称作“免费ARP”，目的是为了查询网络上是否有和自己IP地址相同的主机，或者用来更新其他主机上的arp高速缓存。
<br><font color=blue size=4>动态绑定  </font><br>在编程时不必知道对象的具体类型就能向它们发送消息的能力
<br><font color=blue size=4>多任务  </font><br>多任务是指系统可以同时运行多个进程，而每个进程也可以同时执行多个线程
<br><font color=blue size=4>多态  </font><br>将同一个消息发送给不同的对象并使各个对象以预定的方式对消息做出响应的能力
<br><font color=blue size=4>数字信封  </font><br>用对称密钥加密的信息和用接收者密钥交换公钥加密的对称密钥组合成一个数字信封。
<br><font color=blue size=4>数字指纹  </font><br>由一个hash算法从要发送的信息中得到一个定长的字符串，也称为信息摘要message digest
<br><font color=blue size=4>数字签名  </font><br>指用户用自己的私钥对原始数据的哈希摘要（信息摘要或数字签名）进行加密所得的数据
<br><font color=blue size=4>数字证书  </font><br>数字证书是一段包含用户身份信息、用户公钥信息以及身份验证机构数字签名的数据。身份验证机构的数字签名可以确保证
<br><font color=blue size=4>线程  </font><br>线程看成是操作系统分配CPU时间的基本实体。系统不停地在各个线程之间切换，它对线程的中断是汇编语言级的。系统为
<br><font color=blue size=4>继承  </font><br>拓展现存的类来生成专有类继承原来类的状态和行为的能力
<br><font color=blue size=4>轴  </font><br>所谓的轴就是指child, descendant, parent, ancestor等等的关键字表明查询的范围
<br><font color=blue size=4>进程  </font><br>进程就是应用程序的运行实例。每个进程都有自己私有的虚拟地址空间。每个进程都有一个主线程，但可以建立另外的线程
